sed:unit.sed:content: Service Bulletin
Replace Batteries
Background

Charging temperature limits for lithium-ion batteries are stricter than the operating limits. Lithium-ion chemistry performs well at elevated temperatures but prolonged exposure to heat reduces battery life.
The lithium-ion batteries in the applicable products may under certain circumstances overheat and fail.
Applicability
Model 781.
Model 787 manufactured before 2014–03–15.
Replacement Material
P129001 Battery replacement tray.
P129107 Battery charger temperature sensor.
Procedure
We recommend that you use a minimum of two people when lifting the battery tray. Attempting this procedure alone could result in personal injury or equipment damage.
Disconnect charger from the mains supply.
Remove front panel by pulling the right hand side of the panel.
Disconnect the battery tray from the charger.
Slide the battery tray outwards and remove from the rack.
Open the right hand side panel by removing the 4 Torx T20 screws and sliding the panel forward.
Disconnect the temperature sensor P129106 from connector S3 and remove the sensor.
Mount the replacement sensor P129107 and connect to S3.
Close the side panel and tighten the 4 Torx T20 screws.
Insert the battery replacement tray and connect to the charger.
Close the front panel.
Connect the charger to the mains supply.
